item.name: ロードアベレージ (1分平均)
ロードアベレージ (5分平均)
ロードアベレージ (15分平均)
切り替え数 [回/秒]
item.description: コンテキストスイッチ数

item.name: CPU使用率 [%]
item.description: CPU utilization in %

trigger.name: CPU高負荷 [5分] (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m)
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

dependency.name: ロードアベレージ上昇 (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)

trigger.name: CPU高負荷 [15分] (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 15m)
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

dependency.name: ロードアベレージ上昇 (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)

trigger.name: CPU高負荷 [30分] (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 30m)
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

dependency.name: ロードアベレージ上昇 (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)

item.name: CPU (Guest) [%]
item.description: ゲストOS実行によるCPU時間の割合

item.name: CPU (Guest nice) [%]
item.description: Time spent running a niced guest (virtual CPU for guest operating systems under the control of the Linux kernel)

item.name: CPU (Idle) [%]
item.description: CPUが使用されていない時間の割合。%iowaitは含まれない

item.name: CPU (Interrupt) [%]
item.description: ハードウェア割り込みによるCPU時間の割合

item.name: CPU (IOwait) [%]
item.description: I/O待ちによるCPUが使用されていない時間の割合

item.name: CPU (Nice) [%]
item.description: 優先度（nice値）設定されたユーザプロセス実行によるCPU時間の割合

item.name: CPU (Softirq) [%]
item.description: ソフトウェア割り込みによるCPU時間の割合

item.name: CPU (Steall) [%]
item.description: ゲストOSがCPU割り当て待ちとなった時間の割合

item.name: CPU (System) [%]
item.description: システムレベル（カーネル）で使用されたCPU時間の割合。%irq、%softは含まれない

item.name: CPU (User) [%]
item.description: ユーザレベル（アプリケーション）で使用されたCPU時間の割合。%niceは含まれな

macro.description: Load per CPU considered sustainable. Tune if needed.

template.name: Linux ファイルシステム

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types.

trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: ファイル数上限警告 (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}:ファイル数上限警告 ({$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Linux Filesystem JP:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Linux Filesystem JP:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total].last()}-{Linux Filesystem JP:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used].last()})<5G or {Linux Filesystem JP:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: 空き容量減少 ({$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 5G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Linux Filesystem JP:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Linux Filesystem JP:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total].last()}-{Linux Filesystem JP:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used].last()})<10G or {Linux Filesystem JP:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: 空き容量減少 ( {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 10G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

dependency.name: {#FSNAME}: 空き容量減少 ({$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
dependency.expression: {Linux Filesystem JP:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Linux Filesystem JP:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total].last()}-{Linux Filesystem JP:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used].last()})<5G or {Linux Filesystem JP:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)

macro.description: This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level

item.name: 最大ファイルオープン
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

item.name: 最大プロセス数
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

dependency.name: プロセス数制限警告 (over 80% used)

item.name: ホスト名
item.description: System host name.

trigger.name: ホスト名変更({ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: サーバ時刻
item.description: System local time of the host.

trigger.name: 時刻ずれ発生 > {$SYSTEM.FUZZYTIME.MAX}s)
trigger.description: The host system time is different from the Zabbix server time.

item.name: CPUアーキテクチャ
item.description: Operating system architecture of the host.

trigger.name: OSバージョン更新
trigger.description: Operating system description has changed. Possible reasons that system has been updated or replaced. Ack to close.

item.name: インストールパッケージ数
カーネルバージョン
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

item.name: 起動経過時間
item.description: System uptime in 'N days, hh:mm:ss' format.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} 再起動
trigger.description: The host uptime is less than 10 minutes

item.name: ログインユーザ数
item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

template.template: Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP
template.name: Linux メモリ

item.name: 空きスワップ量
item.description: The free space of swap volume/file in bytes.

item.name: 空きスワップ量 [%]
item.description: The free space of swap volume/file in percent.

item.name: 全スワップ量
item.description: The total space of swap volume/file in bytes.

item.name: 実空きメモリ量
item.description: Available memory, in Linux, available = free + buffers + cache. On other platforms calculation may vary. See also: https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/manual/appendix/items/vm.memory.size_params

item.name: 空きメモリ量
item.description: Total memory in Bytes

item.name: 実空きメモリ量 [%]
item.description: Memory used percentage is calculated as (100-pavailable)

trigger.name: メモリ使用率上昇 [5分] ( >{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}%)
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

dependency.name: 利用可能メモリ減少 ( < {$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
dependency.expression: {Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP:vm.memory.size[available].min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP:vm.memory.size[total].last()}>0

trigger.name: メモリ使用率上昇 [15分] ( >{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}%)
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

dependency.name: 利用可能メモリ減少 ( < {$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
dependency.expression: {Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP:vm.memory.size[available].min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP:vm.memory.size[total].last()}>0

trigger.name: メモリ使用率上昇 [30分] ( >{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}%)
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

dependency.name: 利用可能メモリ減少 ( < {$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
dependency.expression: {Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP:vm.memory.size[available].min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP:vm.memory.size[total].last()}>0

item.name: 全体メモリ量
item.description: Total memory in Bytes

macro.description: This macro is used as a threshold in memory available trigger.
This macro is used as a threshold in memory utilization trigger.

template.name: Linux ネットワーク
template.description:
Known Issues:
Description: High interface utilization trigger is removed since currently it is not possible to retrieve interface speed to determine the max bandwidth.
Template tooling version used: 0.34

item_prototype.name: If: {#IFNAME}: In 破棄パケット
If: {#IFNAME}: In エラーパケット
If: {#IFNAME}: Out 破棄パケット
If: {#IFNAME}: Out エラーパケット
If: {#IFNAME}: ステータス
item_prototype.description: Indicates the interface RFC2863 operational state as a string. Possible values are:"unknown", "notpresent", "down", "lowerlayerdown", "testing","dormant", "up". Reference: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/ABI/testing/sysfs-class-net

trigger_prototype.name: If {#IFNAME}: リンクダウン
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: If: {#IFNAME}: タイプ
item_prototype.description: Indicates the interface protocol type as a decimal value. See include/uapi/linux/if_arp.h for all possible values. Reference: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/ABI/testing/sysfs-class-net

trigger_prototype.expression: {Linux network interfaces JP:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].change()}<0 and {Linux network interfaces JP:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].last()}>0 and ({Linux network interfaces JP:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].last()}=6 or {Linux network interfaces JP:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].last()}=1) and ({Linux network interfaces JP:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: ({Linux network interfaces JP:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].change()}>0 and {Linux network interfaces JP:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].prev()}>0) or ({Linux network interfaces JP:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}=2)
trigger_prototype.name: If {#IFNAME}: 速度低下
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: If {#IFNAME}: リンクダウン
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Linux network interfaces JP:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}=2 and {Linux network interfaces JP:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].diff()}=1)

dependency.name: If {#IFNAME}: リンクダウン
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Linux network interfaces JP:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}=2 and {Linux network interfaces JP:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].diff()}=1)

graph_prototype.name: If {#IFNAME}: ネットワークトラフィック

macro.description: Filter out loopbacks, nulls, docker veth links and docker0 bridge by default

resource.name: If {#IFNAME}: ネットワークトラフィック

template.name: Linux Server テンプレート(CentOS8)
template.description:
Official Linux template. Requires agent of Zabbix 3.0.14, 3.4.5 and 4.0.0 or newer.
Known Issues:
Description: Network discovery. Zabbix agent as of 4.2 doesn't support items such as net.if.status, net.if.speed.
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/387225-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-for-linux
Template tooling version used: 0.34

template.name: Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP

resource.name: CPU 使用状況 簡易
CPU 使用状況 割合

template.name: Linux ストレージ
template.description:
Known Issues:
Description: If having problems accessing /proc/diskstats on CloudLinux, please read this https://docs.cloudlinux.com/cloudlinux_os_kernel/#virtualized-proc-filesystem. Device: CloudLinux
Template tooling version used: 0.34

item.name: Get /proc/diskstats
item.description: Get contents of /proc/diskstats for discovery and disk stats.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: 平均キューサイズ
item_prototype.description: Current average disk queue, the number of requests outstanding on the disk at the time the performance data is collected.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: IOPS
item_prototype.description: r/s. The number (after merges) of read requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: 読み込み待ち時間
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: IOPS 読み込み
item_prototype.description: r/s. The number (after merges) of read requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: 読み込み時間
item_prototype.description: Rate of total read time counter. Used in r_await calculation

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: ディスク稼働率
item_prototype.description: This item is the percentage of elapsed time that the selected disk drive was busy servicing read or writes requests.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: 書き込み待ち時間
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: IOPS 書き込み
item_prototype.description: w/s. The number (after merges) of write requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: 書き込み時間
item_prototype.description: Rate of total write time counter. Used in w_await calculation

trigger_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: ディスクIO警告 (read > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m or write > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m)
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger might indicate disk {#DEVNAME} saturation.

graph_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: 稼働率 キューサイズ

macro.description: This macro is used in block devices discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in block devices discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
Disk read average response time (in ms) before the trigger would fire
Disk write average response time (in ms) before the trigger would fire

trigger.expression: {Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP:system.swap.size[,pfree].min(5m)}<{$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN} and {Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP:system.swap.size[,total].last()}>0
trigger.name: SWAP使用率上昇 ( less than {$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN}% free)
trigger.description: This trigger is ignored, if there is no swap configured

dependency.name: 利用可能メモリ減少 ( < {$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
dependency.expression: {Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP:vm.memory.size[available].min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP:vm.memory.size[total].last()}>0

trigger.name: プロセス数制限警告 (over 80% used)
ロードアベレージ上昇 (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
trigger.description: Per CPU load average is too high. Your system may be slow to respond.

trigger.expression: {Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP:vm.memory.size[available].min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Linux memory by Zabbix agent JP:vm.memory.size[total].last()}>0
trigger.name: 利用可能メモリ減少 ( < {$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
